I accept Data collection disclosure %s uses the Android VPN service to provide you with uncensored access to Internet content. We collect, aggregate, and store the following information: Your city, country, and ISP are derived from the IP address that you connect to our servers from, and the IP address itself is never logged. This data is collected for usage and performance statistics and service health purposes.> Your email, when you send us a diagnostics or crash log feedback. Providing email in the feedback is optional. Your PsiCash account username, password, and optionally, email. Close %s Notifications %s uses notifications to provide you with important information when the app is in the background. This includes: Changes to your VPN connection state. Problems with your connection. Crash reports. MalAware alerts. New app versions available. You can disable notifications in the app settings at any time. Please enable NFC in settings Error communicating with the other device. Please check that Psiphon is open and connected on the other device and try again. Waiting for NFC interaction with the other device… Connection information exchanged successfully! Error communicating with the other device. Please try again. Device moved too fast, connection lost. Please try again. Unsupported NFC tag discovered. Is Psiphon open and connected on the other device? Reading data… Get help connecting Help Skip Next Done If you are having trouble connecting to a Psiphon server, find a friend who has successfully connected and share their connection information using NFC. Make sure that Psiphon is open and connected and the Psiphon Bump icon is showing in the app bar on the other device. With the Psiphon Bump dialog open on your device and the Psiphon app open and connected on the other device, place your devices back to back to initiate a connection information data transfer. Once the connection information data transfer is complete and your Psiphon app is able to connect, the Psiphon Bump dialog will close automatically. If you still cannot connect, you can retry until Psiphon connects successfully. Psiphon Bump Please turn on NFC in the system settings to enable Psiphon Bump helper mode. Open settings
